09c56b758603432bffee8a7f729444dc (13:51): can I add a <script language="JavaScript">...</script> also in the body?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (13:52): drache: In HTML 3.2, sure.
09c56b758603432bffee8a7f729444dc (13:52): I have a php site, and I want to add this there.

8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (13:52): drache: HTML 4.x deprecated the language attribute and made the type attribute required - but script elements are still allowed in the body (otherwise document.write() losing 90% of its usefulness)
09c56b758603432bffee8a7f729444dc (13:52): and can I use onLoad="" in every html tag?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (13:53): drache: No, <body> and <frameset> only - http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/index/attributes.html
2fcb99a2d36de3c57fe4413d6ba5f9d3 (13:53): <script type="text/javascript"></script>
09c56b758603432bffee8a7f729444dc (13:53): ok, but how can I make my <div> tag to run a function when loaded?
09c56b758603432bffee8a7f729444dc (13:54): at this point the <body> is allready sent
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (13:54): drache: <div></div><script ...> myFunc(); </script>
620b41f957c687f6f8046ee4244a85dc (13:54): i wonder if responseText.length returns the number of bytes read so far after readystate is 3
2fcb99a2d36de3c57fe4413d6ba5f9d3 (13:54): http://www.openjsan.org/doc/a/au/autarch/DOM/Ready/0.14/lib/DOM/Ready.html
2fcb99a2d36de3c57fe4413d6ba5f9d3 (13:54): will do that for you
2fcb99a2d36de3c57fe4413d6ba5f9d3 (13:54): yea or just embed it inline
2fcb99a2d36de3c57fe4413d6ba5f9d3 (13:55): zithowa: i thought 3 was the last one ?
620b41f957c687f6f8046ee4244a85dc (13:57): no, that's 4: loaded.  3 is receiving
620b41f957c687f6f8046ee4244a85dc (13:58): http://www.treebuilder.de/default.asp?file=503627.xml says responseText.length returns the amount of data loaded so far 8)

d64357f3159d23039a242d182967c52b (14:01): hy. is there any way to reference an element by something else than ID. the thing is i have categories and i want to reference element sometimes by category sometimes by id.
2fcb99a2d36de3c57fe4413d6ba5f9d3 (14:02): category ?
d64357f3159d23039a242d182967c52b (14:03): i mean i have let's say groups of elements

8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (14:03): yure: There is name, in the case of form controls and frames, and there is element type, but no direct way to grab an element by anything else. (And I've no idea what a "category" is in this contect, since HTML (which I assume you are using, as its most common) doesn't come with an explicit built in way to give that information.
2fcb99a2d36de3c57fe4413d6ba5f9d3 (14:04): maybe you want to use a class ?
d64357f3159d23039a242d182967c52b (14:04): can i reference an element by class?
2fcb99a2d36de3c57fe4413d6ba5f9d3 (14:04): Flannel:  he needs your warmthness here
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (14:04): yure: Not directly. You can loop over elements and test against the className property of them.
d64357f3159d23039a242d182967c52b (14:05): how about name. sth like GetElementByName?
2fcb99a2d36de3c57fe4413d6ba5f9d3 (14:05): yes but ie from waht i hear broke it
